org.deeplearning4j.spark.api.stats

Interface SparkTrainingStats

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommonSparkTrainingStats, ParameterAveragingTrainingMasterStats, ParameterAveragingTrainingWorkerStats

    public interface SparkTrainingStats
extends java.io.Serializable
    SparkTrainingStats is an interface that is used for accessing training statistics, for multiple TrainingMaster implementations.

    The idea is that for debugging purposes, we want to collect a number of statistics related to the training. However, these statistics will vary, depending on which the type of training we are doing. Specifically, both the keys (number/names of stats) and their actual values (types/classes) can vary.

    The interface here operates essentially as a Map<String,Object>. Note however that SparkTrainingStats instances may be nested: for example a ParameterAveragingTrainingMasterStats may have a CommonSparkTrainingStats instance which may in turn have a ParameterAveragingTrainingWorkerStats instance.

      • getKeySet

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeySet()
        Returns:

      • getValue

        java.util.List<EventStats> getValue(java.lang.String key)
        Get the statistic value for this key
        Parameters:
        key - Key to get the value for
        Returns:
        Statistic for this key, or an exception if key is invalid

      • getShortNameForKey

        java.lang.String getShortNameForKey(java.lang.String key)
        Return a short (display) name for the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - Key
        Returns:
        Short/display name for key

      • defaultIncludeInPlots

        boolean defaultIncludeInPlots(java.lang.String key)
        When plotting statistics, we don't necessarily want to plot everything. For example, some statistics/measurements are made up multiple smaller components; it does not always make sense to plot both the larger stat, and the components that make it up
        Parameters:
        key - Key to check for default plotting behaviour
        Returns:
        Whether the specified key should be included in plots by default or not

      • addOtherTrainingStats

        void addOtherTrainingStats(SparkTrainingStats other)
        Combine the two training stats instances. Usually, the two objects must be of the same type
        Parameters:
        other - Other training stats to return

      • getNestedTrainingStats

        SparkTrainingStats getNestedTrainingStats()
        Return the nested training stats - if any.
        Returns:
        The nested stats, if present/applicable, or null otherwise

      • statsAsString

        java.lang.String statsAsString()
        Get a String representation of the stats. This functionality is implemented as a separate method (as opposed to toString()) as the resulting String can be very large.
        NOTE: The String representation typically includes only duration information. To get full statistics (including machine IDs, etc) use getValue(String) or export full data via exportStatFiles(String, SparkContext)
        Returns:
        A String represetation of the training statistics

      • exportStatFiles

        void exportStatFiles(java.lang.String outputPath,
                     SparkContext sc)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Export the stats as a collection of files. Stats are comma-delimited (CSV) with 1 header line
        Parameters:
        outputPath - Base directory to write files to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
